content.description:
Top Priorities for the President and Congress

Survey of 1,503 adults, conducted Jan. 10-15, 2018.

Source: Pew Research Center, 2018
content.question: Which of the following best explains the data in the line graph?

choices.label: Between 2012 and 2018, the economy did not grow enough to make economic issues a top priority.
Voters care more about jobs than the budget deficit because there has been an increase in unemployment between 2010 and 2018.
The economy is likely the most important issue because it is a broader category that is more open to individual interpretation than both jobs and the budget deficit.
Complex issues such as the budget deficit receive little attention in the media even though citizens care deeply about them.

content.answer: The economy is likely the most important issue because it is a broader category that is more open to individual interpretation than both jobs and the budget deficit.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
